service.tut.pori.contentanalysis

Class PhotoDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.tut.pori.dao.SolrDAO
      • service.tut.pori.contentanalysis.PhotoDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware

    public class PhotoDAO
extends SolrDAO
    This class can be used to add, remove and modify photo metadata, and also to associate the photos with media objects.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class core.tut.pori.dao.SolrDAO

        MAX_DOCUMENT_COUNT, SOLR_COMMIT_WITHIN, SOLR_FIELD_ID

        public boolean insert(MediaObjectList objects)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true on success

      • setOwners

        public boolean setOwners(PhotoList photos)
        Sets the owner details (userId) to the given photos, requires that GUID has been set to the photo object
        Parameters:
        photos -
        Returns:
        true on success, Note: the failed photos will have userId of null, thus, this method can also be used to check the existence of the given photos.

      • updatePhotosIfNewer

        public boolean updatePhotosIfNewer(UserIdentity authenticatedUser,
                                   PhotoList photos)
        Update the photos only the given photos have newer timestamps than the ones in the database Note: media objects, if present on the photos, will be updated/inserted, old objects will never be removed (i.e. this will NOT SET object, but only updates the object details). If you want to remove previously existing media objects, use MediaObjectDAO.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        photos -
        Returns:
        true on success, note that nothing updated also equals to true if no other errors occur

      • updatePhotos

        public boolean updatePhotos(UserIdentity authenticatedUser,
                            PhotoList photos)
        Update the photos only the given photos have newer timestamps than the ones in the database Note: media objects, if present on the photos, will be updated/inserted, old objects will never be removed (i.e. this will NOT SET object, but only updates the object details). If you want to remove previously existing media objects, use MediaObjectDAO.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        photos -
        Returns:
        true on success

      • getAccessDetails

        public java.util.List<AccessDetails> getAccessDetails(UserIdentity authenticatedUser,
                                                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> guids)
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        guids -
        Returns:
        access details for the photos, or null if none of the photo exist

      • getAccessDetails

        public AccessDetails getAccessDetails(UserIdentity authenticatedUser,
                                      java.lang.String guid)
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        guid -
        Returns:
        access details for the photo, or null if the photo does not exist

      • deassociate

        public void deassociate(java.lang.String guid,
                        java.lang.String mediaObjectId)
        Note: this will NOT remove the media object, and it will only remove the association between the given GUID and media object id. Use MediaObjectDAO if you want to remove the media objects.
        Parameters:
        guid - if null, the given media object will be de-associated from all GUIDs
        mediaObjectId - if null, all media objects for the given GUID will be de-associated

        public void associate(PhotoList photos)
        create photo-media object associations from the given photo list

        photos -
